meanings.definition: To form or develop epithelial tissue.
meanings.sent1: The wound epithelializes to heal the skin.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained how skin epithelializes after a cut.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's power was to epithelialize wounds instantly.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness epithelializes the community, bringing people together like skin cells.
meanings.sent5: Watching the flower petals epithelialize in time-lapse was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: To cover or line with epithelial cells.
meanings.sent1: The surgeon epithelializes the organ to protect it during the procedure.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied how the body epithelializes various surfaces.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret recipe was to epithelialize the pan with butter before cooking.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush epithelializes the canvas with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The rain epithelializes the leaves, creating a shiny protective layer.
